thread.title: 4 cops killed, 1 hurt in Davao NPA ambush
thread.title_full: 4 cops killed, 1 hurt in Davao NPA ambush

title: 4 cops killed, 1 hurt in Davao NPA ambush
text:
4 cops killed, 1 hurt in Davao NPA ambush (The Philippine Star) | Updated March 9, 2017 - 12:00am Photo shows the police officers slain in an ambush in Davao del Sur yesterday. JOHN UNSON 
DAVAO CITY, Philippines – Four police officers were killed in an ambush by suspected New People’s Army (NPA) rebels in Davao del Sur yesterday. 
Police Officers 1 Rolly Benelayo, Joe Narvaza and Saro Mangutara of the Bansalan police and PO3 Jayden May Rabor of the Scene of the Crime Operatives were responding to a shooting incident that left two villagers dead in Barangay Sibayan when they were waylaid at around 7:30 a.m. 
PO3 Allen Arnado was wounded and taken to a hospital for treatment. 
Personnel of the Army’s 39th and 73rd Infantry Battalion and Citizen Armed Forces Geographical Unit launched pursuit operations for the rebels. 
The Philippine National Police condemned the attack, saying the “ruthless treachery of the NPA reared its ugly head again.” 
Meanwhile, four NPA rebels were killed in a firefight with government troops in Barangay Mabunga in San Francisco, Quezon on Tuesday.   
No casualties were reported on the government side. 
Soldiers belonging to the 85th Infantry Battalion were patrolling the area when they encountered the rebels. 
Three caliber .45 pistols and improvised explosive devices were recovered from the rebels after another clash in Barangay Tabgon in Camarines Sur at around 1:05 p.m. – Edith Regalado, John Unson, Michelle Zoleta, Ed Amoroso, Michael Punongbayan, Emmanuel Tupas, Cecille Suerte Felipe
